text:
Explore (Digging In)

Providing for Individual Needs

The Initial Challenge and What If...? Situation A give students the opportunity to scale the ratios of ages up and down, i.e., to rewrite using greater and lesser numbers. What If...? Situation B works using greater and lesser numbers. What If...? Situation B works backward by starting with a smoothie bar and asking students to find the children's ages.

As students work, listen for their ability to describe why their ratios are equivalent. (Language)

Suggested Questions

  • Would scaling up or down be helpful?
  • How do you know your ratios are equivalent?

Possible Correct Strategies

Using Pictures and Common Factors In What If...? Situation A, Jared's and Peter's ages are 10 and 15. These ages have a common factor of 5. We can use this common factor to notice that the ratio 2 to 3 is equivalent to the ratio 10 and 15 by making 2 groups of 5 from 10 and 3 groups of 5 from 15.
